TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit ParserError extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a parser error or warning. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A ParserError object represents an error that is created when an <xref:System.Web.HttpParseException> exception is thrown. A parser error object can contain error message text, a virtual path to the file where the error occurred, and the subsequent line number of the error in that file. If more than one parser error occurs or you want to store multiple parser errors in a centralized location, use the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection> object.
A parser error is of the type <xref:System.Web.HttpException>. For more information on exceptions and how to handle them, go to [MSDN Library](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37118).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to add a new parser error to a <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection> object.
[!code-vb[System.Web.ParserErrorCollection#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.parsererror_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[System.Web.ParserErrorCollection#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.parsererror_1.aspx)]

remarks.format:

[!code-vb[System.Web.ParserError#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.parsererror_2_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[System.Web.ParserError#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.parsererror_2_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: public ParserError (string errorText, string virtualPath, int line);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string errorText, string virtualPath, int32 line) cil managed

Docs.param: The virtual path of the file being parsed when the error occurred.
The line number of the error source.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using the specified error text, virtual path, and source line number.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the ParserError constructor to initialize a <xref:System.Web.ParserError> object with custom settings. The ParserError constructor has the following properties:
- The <xref:System.Web.ParserError.ErrorText%2A> property, which is a string containing the error message that is related to the parser error.
- The <xref:System.Web.ParserError.VirtualPath%2A> property, which is a read-only string that specifies the virtual path of the file that contains the parser error.
- The <xref:System.Web.ParserError.Line%2A> property, whichis the line number within the file at which this <xref:System.Web.ParserError> object was thrown.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a string that represents the error for the object.
Docs.value: A string containing the error message.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the ErrorText property to provide a programmer-defined error message for parser errors for display in a <xref:System.Web.ParserError> object.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to populate the ErrorText property for a <xref:System.Web.ParserError> object.
[!code-vb[System.Web.ParserError#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.parsererror_2_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[System.Web.ParserError#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.parsererror_2_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the line number of the source at which the error occurs.
Docs.value: The source line number where the parser encountered the error.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Line propertyis the line number within the file at which this <xref:System.Web.ParserError> object was thrown.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to populate the Line property for a <xref:System.Web.ParserError> object.
[!code-vb[System.Web.ParserError#4](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.parsererror_1_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[System.Web.ParserError#4](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.parsererror_1_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets or set the virtual path of the file that was being parsed when the error occurred.
Docs.value: A string that specifies the virtual path of the file that contains the parser error.

remarks.format:
